articles.description: The Nebraska Cornhuskers have transformed their quarterback depth chart through the transfer portal, adding former Florida State Seminole Chubba Purdy to a group that includes former Texas Longhorn Casey Thompson.
articles.headline: QB Chubba Purdy chooses to transfer to Nebraska after leaving Florida State football program

images.name: Caleb Williams [608x342]
images.caption: Freshman Caleb Williams came off the bench to help lead Oklahoma to a thrilling comeback victory over Texas.

images.name: Kedon Slovis [608x342]
images.caption: Kedon Slovis announced he will transfer from USC to Pitt.

images.name: Lyn-j Dixon [608x342]
images.caption: Lyn-J Dixon had 104 carries for 635 yards and six touchdowns with Clemson in 2019, but has totaled only 52 carries for 238 yards in two years since.

images.name: Kai-Leon Herbert [608x342]
images.caption: Senior Kai-Leon Herbert was the No. 99 prospect in the 2017 class. He opted out of the 2020 season and has mainly been a reserve for Miami.

images.caption: Former ESPN 300 cornerback Marcus Banks played in 23 total games with Alabama before entering the transfer portal.

articles.description: More college football players are entering the transfer portal each year. As the season winds down, we will analyze top players as they enter the portal and make new commitments.
articles.headline: College football transfer portal tracker: Top players, predictions, analysis, more

articles.headline: Alabama Crimson Tide LB Christian Harris says he's entering NFL draft

articles.description: After four seasons at Northwestern, quarterback Hunter Johnson is transferring back to Clemson -- a rare transfer to Dabo Swinney's program.
articles.headline: Onetime Clemson football recruit QB Hunter Johnson transfers back to Tigers after career at Northwestern

images.name: Nolan Smith forces fumble with strip sack
images.caption: Georgia LB Nolan Smith gets to the QB and forces a fumble vs. South Carolina.

articles.description: Georgia's top-ranked defense won't look the same next season, but it will feature the return of gifted pass-rusher Nolan Smith, who announced Monday that he plans to come back for his senior season.
articles.headline: Star pass-rusher Nolan Smith returning to Georgia Bulldogs for senior season

articles.description: Former Louisiana-Lafayette OL O'Cyrus Torrence, who was an All-Sun Belt selection the last two years, will be reunited with Gators coach Billy Napier after committing to transferring to Florida.
articles.headline: Former Louisiana-Lafayette offensive lineman O'Cyrus Torrence to transfer to Florida Gators

article.headline: Wofford 56, Chattanooga 7
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Ben Widmyer accounted for four touchdowns to lead Wofford to a 56-7 rout over Chattanooga Saturday. Widmyer completed 3 of 5 passes for 110 yards and two touchdowns, and rushed for 158 yards and two more scores on eight carries for the Terriers (4-1, 2-0 Southern Conference). The Terriers outgained the Moccasins (1-6, 0-3) 564-191 in the game. Widmyer scored the only points of the opening quarter with a 75-yard run, which Chattanooga matched when Jare Gault connected with Chris Pitchford on an 11-yard touchdown to open the second at 7-7. But it would be all Wofford the rest of the way as Widmyer ran for a 35-yard score and connected with Fenn Allen on a 28-yard pass to make it 28-7 at halftime. The Terriers scored 28 unanswered points in the second half, including Widmyer's 50-yard touchdwon pass to Andy Strickland. Dane Romero's 5-yard rush, Arsenio Parks' 20-yard run and Robby Davis' 11-yard scamper blew the game open for Wofford in the second half.
